title: VIP: kwarg to allow manually handling call success
body:
## Simple Summary
Add a kwarg, provisionally `revert_on_failure=True` to all calls which, when set to `False`, allows the programmer to catch the result of a call. The default behavior would be `revert_on_failure=True`, which is identical to the current behavior.

```python
output = raw_call(...) # current behavior, reverts if the output of underlying call is 0
output = raw_call(..., revert_on_failure=True) # identical
success, output = raw_call(..., revert_on_failure=False) # new behavior
```
The tuple `(success, output)` is used to match solidity.

## Motivation
Right now you can't handle failed calls except the automatic behavior which is to revert.

## Specification

## Backwards Compatibility
No known issues

## Dependencies

## References
This is an alternative to (and easier to implement than) https://github.com/vyperlang/vyper/issues/1517

## Copyright
Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/)

@fubuloubu @charles-cooper is this included in 3.0? if not, can I find it in any dev branch or is it WIP or not started?

If not available yet, do you know if there is **any other way** to have multiple raw_call and to not revert the whole transaction if any of those calls fail? so you would see message like:

"Although one or more Error Occurred [execution reverted] Contract Execution Completed"

in the Etherscan and the success calls before the failed one will show up as completed.
Not started yet, taking contributions to make it happen, should be straightforwards

@fubuloubu I reviewed the Solidity code for try / catch but it's too complex for me to understand properly. Checked the Vyper source code but got stuck on the from_list method.

If you know any ad hoc solution or point me some specific place in the code I would try myself. Cheers.

In general, there are very few use cases I would recommend manually handling call success. Often the best thing you can do is to just allow the revert. I can only think of something like multisigs, where the execution needs to be tracked even if it fails in order for the protocol to be safe and not run into a deadlock issue.
@adapt7 let me check the code and see if I can recommend a good place to jump in
@fubuloubu do you think we should allow the `revert_on_failure` kwarg with non-raw_call calls?

> @fubuloubu do you think we should allow the `revert_on_failure` kwarg with non-raw_call calls?

Personally no, but I could see why people would want this feature
Not exactly a dependency for the implementation but #2480 will be helpful for the usability of this feature.

@fubuloubu @charles-cooper my case scenario is pretty simple, let's say I have three raw_calls in row:

raw_call
raw_call
raw_call

and the second one fails. At the moment the whole transaction fails and is quite expensive.

My expectation is to handle raw_call error so in the end, the first raw_call succeed, second one fails and is reverted, third one does not start. The whole call will not be reverted, first call will be completed.

At the moment if any of those three raw_calls fail, whole transaction is reverted.
@charles-cooper is your commit ready to play with and do some tests or is it still WIP and better not to test yet?
Should be ready for trying it out

@charles-cooper getting:

```UnboundLocalError: local variable 'call_success_node' referenced before assignment```
@adapt7 that case should be fixed in c928085f48803b51b4ab3da16c99c3bb151d3fc4, can you check again?

@adapt7 can you paste a repro? At least the usage of `raw_call`.

@charles-cooper 

`succ: bool`

...

```
resp: Bytes[128] = convert("0", Bytes[128])

self.succ, resp = raw_call(self.router, full_data, value=as_wei_value(_tamountpre, 'wei'), gas=msg.gas, max_outsize=128, revert_on_failure=False)
@adapt7 sorry about that. Should be fixed in 45af922f26050b3948b15dafc0085a3b5ff2d8df
@charles-cooper compilation completes fine now. Will do more tests and come back to you. Thank you.

@charles-cooper 

```
				response2post: Bytes[32] = convert("0", Bytes[32])
				success2post: bool = False

				success2post, response2post = raw_call(self.router, full_data2post, gas=msg.gas, max_outsize=32, revert_on_failure=False)

				if success2post == False:
					# never happens regardless raw_call is success or not

```
				response2post: Bytes[32] = convert("0", Bytes[32])
				success2post: bool = False

				success2post, response2post = raw_call(self.router, full_data2post, gas=msg.gas, max_outsize=32, revert_on_failure=False)

				if success2post != True:
					# always happens regardless raw_call is success or not

Initial tests results are odd, see above. Do you see any obvious issues with my code? Could you check yours as well?
@adapt7 thank you for the test result, I found a bug in my code. I will push a fix shortly.
@adapt7 see b826f4967dc32a59b1d159c20bf4ba9113b1bc18
done in https://github.com/vyperlang/vyper/pull/2482
@charles-cooper many thanks, all seem to work as expected.
NOTE: No docs were added for this
